pageTitle: P&G Excels, Ups 2013 View - January 25, 2013 - Zacks.com
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {25794=Fiscal 2013 Outlook Upped, 14868=by Zacks Equity Research   Published on January 25, 2013 |, 26245=The company also upped its previously provided core earnings guidance range of $3.80–$4.00 to $3.97–$4.07. The new guidance represents a growth rate of 3%–6% from 2012 levels, surpassing the prior expectation of a year-over-year movement of a negative 1% to a positive 4%. The better outlook emanated from the expectation of stronger productivity improvements, cost savings and higher share repurchases., 20482=Procter & Gamble Company (PG - Analyst Report) reported second quarter fiscal 2013 adjusted earnings (excluding restructuring charges) of $1.22 per share, which surpassed the Zacks Consensus Estimate of 1.11 cents by almost 10%. Earnings also beat management guidance of $1.07 to $1.13 and improved 12% from the prior-year level driven by solid organic sales growth and improved productivity., 27806=Competitor, Kimberly-Clark Corporation (KMB - Analyst Report) also announced its fourth quarter 2012 results today, beating the Zacks Consensus Estimate for both revenues and earnings., 21845=Fiscal 2012 was a tough year for P&G and the company plans to implement some meaningful changes to re-accelerate its top and bottom-line growth in keeping with the peer companies. In addition, the company has implemented costs savings and productivity improvement initiatives in order to improve margins., 27476=In the third quarter of fiscal 2013, the company expects both net and organic revenues to range between 3% and 4%. Foreign exchange is expected to have a neutral impact on sales. Core earnings are expected to remain in the range of $0.91 to $0.97, representing a movement in the range of negative 3% to positive 3%., 27136=The company is also focusing on driving its 20 biggest innovations like Tide Pods, Always Radiance, Bounty Trap & Lock and Bounty Unstoppables in more markets in fiscal 2013. Moreover, the company is also concentrating on its 10 most important developing markets., 22168=All these efforts are bearing fruit as evident from 2 back to back solid quarterly results. Following the solid first half results, P&G raised its sales and earnings outlook for fiscal 2013., 25851=Management increased its organic sales growth guidance to a range of 3% to 4% from prior expectations of 2% to 4%. Net revenues are expected to rise between 1% and 2% better than the prior guidance of growth remaining flat or increasing upto 1% from 2012 levels. Currency is expected to hurt revenues by 2% lower than the prior expectation of a headwind in the range of 2% to 3%., 27418=Third Quarter 2013 Outlook, 68929=At the center of everything we do is a strong commitment to independent research and sharing its profitable discoveries with investors. This dedication to giving investors a trading advantage led to the creation of our proven Zacks Rank stock-rating system. Since 1986 it has nearly tripled the S&P 500 with an average gain of +26% per year. These returns cover a period from 1986-2011 and were examined and attested by Baker Tilly, an independent accounting firm., 68868=Copyright © 2015 Zacks Investment Research}
